title: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906 [Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor, and there is no error message displayed.
OB: When attempting to open a Java file in the System Editor from the Java Perspective, after it has been opened in the workbench, no warning or error message is shown. This behavior seems to be a safety feature preventing external editing while the file is already open in WSAD.
EB: When trying to open a file in the System Editor from the Java Perspective, a warning message should appear if the file is already open, indicating the potential for overwriting changes. Alternatively, an error message should prompt the user to close all files first before proceeding.
SR:
1. Ensure that you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file.
2. If not, go to the file explorer, double-click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
3. In the Java Perspective, right-click on a Java file, then select 'Open With' followed by 'System Editor'.
4. A Notepad or WordPad window should appear with the Java file opened.
5. Close the file.
6. Go to the Java Perspective, open a Java file by double-clicking on it.
7. Right-click on the Java file, select 'Open With', then choose 'System Editor'.
8. The workbench should display a warning message indicating the possibility of overwriting changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should prompt you to close all files first.
